intro: Amsinckia brachysantha, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Its botanical features make it an attractive and resilient plant for xeriscaping and native gardens.
